Issue #24 Renault 18 Break Proto 1985 C. Marreau/B. Marreau

The 1985 Dakar departed from Versailles, France on January 1, 1985. The route took the competitors through France, Algeria, Niger, Mali, Mauritania, and Senegal for a total of 4,642 competitive miles finishing in Dakar, Senegal on January 22, 1985.

The Marreau brothers, Claude and Bernard, were the only team representing Renault this year and finished in a respectable 5th place with no stage wins. After 7 years of loyalty to Renault, this would be the last year the Marreaus would set out in a Renault.

Sources
History of Dakar - RETROSPECTIVE 1979-2007
